Module chessClockWork
Package time

Class TimeControl

java.lang.Object
time.TimeControl
public final class TimeControl extends Object
The time control which is the heart of this chess clock. To be fair, this class leaves all the details of accounting to the PlayerTimeCOntrol. But this class manages everything
Since:
1.0;

  • Method Details

    • makeNew

      public static Optional<TimeControl> makeNew(ClockDisplay clockDisplay)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      clockDisplay - The clock display that is responsible for displaying the times.
      Returns:
      An optional with the new instance.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setPlayerTimeDisplay

      public void setPlayerTimeDisplay(int playerNo, PlayerTimeDisplay display)
      Sets the recipient of a player's timing data.
      Parameters:
      playerNo - Index of player. The left player is 0, the right one is 1. Does nothign for other numbers.
      display - The recipient for the data.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setupNewGameTiming

      public void setupNewGameTiming(TimeBudgetConstraint dataLeft, TimeBudgetConstraint dataRight, boolean leftIsWhite, boolean timeRunsInFirstMove)
      Sets all data for a new game and tells all displays what they need to know now.
      Parameters:
      dataLeft - Left player's data.
      dataRight - Right player's data.
      leftIsWhite - Does the left player plays with the white pieces?
      timeRunsInFirstMove - The time is ticking down also in the first move if and only if this parameter is set to true.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setupNewGameTiming

      public void setupNewGameTiming(TimeBudgetConstraint dataLeft, TimeBudgetConstraint dataRight, boolean leftIsWhite)
      Sets all data for a new game and tells all displays what they need to know now. During the first move, the time does not run.
      Parameters:
      dataLeft - Left player's data.
      dataRight - Right player's data.
      leftIsWhite - Does the left player plays with the white pieces?
      Since:
      1.0;

    • notifyMoveDone

      public void notifyMoveDone()
      Called when a move is done. Invoking this method is the digital equivalent of pressing the lever on a physical chess clock. It causes that the time is taken from the opponents budget from now on.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • notifyPauseChangeRequest

      public void notifyPauseChangeRequest()
      Called when the pause status changes. Does nothing if the current state is noneRunning.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • endSignalClock

      public void endSignalClock()
      Signals the clock that it shall come to an end. Note that this end is forever. So call this method only when you shut down and exit from the application.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • wakeSignalClockUp

      public void wakeSignalClockUp()
      Signals the clock that it shall wake up.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • startClock

      public void startClock()
      Signals the clock that is shall start. Needs to be called exactly once in the beginning of the application.
      Since:
      1.0;
